trans-unit.source: Configuring Agreements from a BizTalk perspective
trans-unit.target: Configuring Agreements from a BizTalk perspective

trans-unit.source: Configuring EDI messaging in the <token>tpm_full</token> is different when compared with BizTalk Server TPM Portal.
trans-unit.target: Configuring EDI messaging in the <token>tpm_full</token> is different when compared with BizTalk Server TPM Portal.

trans-unit.source: Following is an overview of the <token>af_integration_full</token> steps to configuring in the <token>tpm_full</token>:
trans-unit.target: Following is an overview of the <token>af_integration_full</token> steps to configuring in the <token>tpm_full</token>:

trans-unit.source: The first time you log in, you are prompted to register you/your company’s BizTalk Service deployment.
trans-unit.target: The first time you log in, you are prompted to register you/your company’s BizTalk Service deployment.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="4ba64033-e9d8-472f-a00f-261b540ac96f#BKMK_BTSParty" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">BizTalk Server “Party” and BizTalk Services “Partners”</link> section discusses these steps.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="4ba64033-e9d8-472f-a00f-261b540ac96f#BKMK_BTSParty" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">BizTalk Server “Party” and BizTalk Services “Partners”</link> section discusses these steps.

trans-unit.source: When “partners” are created in the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, a profile is automatically created for every partner.
trans-unit.target: When “partners” are created in the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, a profile is automatically created for every partner.

trans-unit.source: You can also create new profiles or update the existing profile.
trans-unit.target: You can also create new profiles or update the existing profile.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="4ba64033-e9d8-472f-a00f-261b540ac96f#BKMK_BTSProfile" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">BizTalk Server “Profile” and BizTalk Services “Profile”</link> section discusses this information.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="4ba64033-e9d8-472f-a00f-261b540ac96f#BKMK_BTSProfile" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">BizTalk Server “Profile” and BizTalk Services “Profile”</link> section discusses this information.

trans-unit.source: Create an X12 or AS2 agreement between the partners.
trans-unit.target: Create an X12 or AS2 agreement between the partners.

trans-unit.source: General Settings, Receive Settings, and Send Settings are configured.
trans-unit.target: General Settings, Receive Settings, and Send Settings are configured.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="4ba64033-e9d8-472f-a00f-261b540ac96f#BKMK_BTSAgreement" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">BizTalk Server “Agreement” and BizTalk Services “Agreement”</link> section discusses this information.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="4ba64033-e9d8-472f-a00f-261b540ac96f#BKMK_BTSAgreement" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">BizTalk Server “Agreement” and BizTalk Services “Agreement”</link> section discusses this information.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="4ba64033-e9d8-472f-a00f-261b540ac96f#BKMK_BTSEnable" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">BizTalk Server “Enable” and BizTalk Services “Deploy</link> section discusses this information.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="4ba64033-e9d8-472f-a00f-261b540ac96f#BKMK_BTSEnable" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">BizTalk Server “Enable” and BizTalk Services “Deploy</link> section discusses this information.

trans-unit.source: This topic acts as a guide for configuring EDI components in <token>af_integration</token> compared to BizTalk Server.
trans-unit.target: This topic acts as a guide for configuring EDI components in <token>af_integration</token> compared to BizTalk Server.

trans-unit.source: A “party” in BizTalk Server is called a “partner” in <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: A “party” in BizTalk Server is called a “partner” in <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: The following tables compare the “party” settings in BizTalk Server with the “partner” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: The following tables compare the “party” settings in BizTalk Server with the “partner” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: Represent you or your company to send messages or receive messages
trans-unit.target: Represent you or your company to send messages or receive messages

trans-unit.source: This table lists the different tasks involved when registering you or your company’s BizTalk Service deployment.
trans-unit.target: This table lists the different tasks involved when registering you or your company’s BizTalk Service deployment.

trans-unit.source: It lists the “party” tasks in BizTalk Server and the replacement “partner” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: It lists the “party” tasks in BizTalk Server and the replacement “partner” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Administration, create a new Party and check <ui>Local BizTalk processes messages received by the party or supports sending messages from this party</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Administration, create a new Party and check <ui>Local BizTalk processes messages received by the party or supports sending messages from this party</ui>.

trans-unit.source: This option establishes you or your company as the service provider.
trans-unit.target: This option establishes you or your company as the service provider.

trans-unit.source: This is the only time you check this option when creating a party.
trans-unit.target: This is the only time you check this option when creating a party.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>How to Create a Party</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247301</linkUri></externalLink> provides the details.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>How to Create a Party</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247301</linkUri></externalLink> provides the details.

trans-unit.source: The first time you log in to the <token>tpm_portal</token>, you register you/your company’s BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The first time you log in to the <token>tpm_portal</token>, you register you/your company’s BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: This is the only time you enter the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: This is the only time you enter the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Once configured, the BizTalk Service cannot be deleted.
trans-unit.target: Once configured, the BizTalk Service cannot be deleted.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="8d8d6123-1102-4757-818d-f74a2ed83256" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Components for Trading Partner Management</link> provides the details.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="8d8d6123-1102-4757-818d-f74a2ed83256" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Components for Trading Partner Management</link> provides the details.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, enter additional details, like your name, phone number, e-mail address, etc.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, enter additional details, like your name, phone number, e-mail address, etc.

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Administration, open your party properties and add <ui>Additional Properties</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Administration, open your party properties and add <ui>Additional Properties</ui>.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>How to Create a Party</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247301</linkUri></externalLink> provides the details.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>How to Create a Party</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247301</linkUri></externalLink> provides the details.

trans-unit.source: The very first time you log in to the <token>tpm_portal</token>, you register you or your company’s BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The very first time you log in to the <token>tpm_portal</token>, you register you or your company’s BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: You can later add additional details.
trans-unit.target: You can later add additional details.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="8d8d6123-1102-4757-818d-f74a2ed83256" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Components for Trading Partner Management</link> provides the details.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="8d8d6123-1102-4757-818d-f74a2ed83256" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Components for Trading Partner Management</link> provides the details.

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Administration, open your party properties and select <ui>Send Ports</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Administration, open your party properties and select <ui>Send Ports</ui>.

trans-unit.source: This associates the send port(s) with your service provider party.
trans-unit.target: This associates the send port(s) with your service provider party.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>How to Create a Party</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247301</linkUri></externalLink> provides the details.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>How to Create a Party</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247301</linkUri></externalLink> provides the details.

trans-unit.source: The “send” is configured when an agreement is created between two partners.
trans-unit.target: The “send” is configured when an agreement is created between two partners.

trans-unit.source: Create the partners using <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Managing Partners and Profiles</link>.
trans-unit.target: Create the partners using <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Managing Partners and Profiles</link>.

trans-unit.source: Create an agreement between the partners using <link xlink:href="df2ee20f-a063-42f8-b9d1-ea6c3abdbfed" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Managing Agreements</link>.
trans-unit.target: Create an agreement between the partners using <link xlink:href="df2ee20f-a063-42f8-b9d1-ea6c3abdbfed" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Managing Agreements</link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure the send settings using X12 Send Settings (<link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an X12 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>) and AS2 Send Settings (<link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>).
trans-unit.target: Configure the send settings using X12 Send Settings (<link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an X12 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>) and AS2 Send Settings (<link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>).

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Administration, open your party properties and select <ui>Certificate</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Administration, open your party properties and select <ui>Certificate</ui>.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>How to Create a Party</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247301</linkUri></externalLink> provides the details.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>How to Create a Party</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247301</linkUri></externalLink> provides the details.

trans-unit.source: The certificate is associated with you or your company’s profile.
trans-unit.target: The certificate is associated with you or your company’s profile.

trans-unit.source: When a partner is created, a profile is automatically created.
trans-unit.target: When a partner is created, a profile is automatically created.

trans-unit.source: A certificate can then be added to the profile.
trans-unit.target: A certificate can then be added to the profile.

trans-unit.source: Add a certificate to the profile.
trans-unit.target: Add a certificate to the profile.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: To add you or your company as a service provider in BizTalk Server, create a party and check the <ui>Local BizTalk processes messages received by the party or supports sending messages from this party</ui> option in the party properties.
trans-unit.target: To add you or your company as a service provider in BizTalk Server, create a party and check the <ui>Local BizTalk processes messages received by the party or supports sending messages from this party</ui> option in the party properties.

trans-unit.source: To register you or your company’s BizTalk Service, log in to the <token>tpm_portal</token> for the very first time and enter your properties.
trans-unit.target: To register you or your company’s BizTalk Service, log in to the <token>tpm_portal</token> for the very first time and enter your properties.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="8d8d6123-1102-4757-818d-f74a2ed83256" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Components for Trading Partner Management</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="8d8d6123-1102-4757-818d-f74a2ed83256" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Components for Trading Partner Management</link>.

trans-unit.source: This table lists the task involved when creating a partner.
trans-unit.target: This table lists the task involved when creating a partner.

trans-unit.source: It lists the “party” task in BizTalk Server and the replacement “partner” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: It lists the “party” task in BizTalk Server and the replacement “partner” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Administration, create a new Party.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Administration, create a new Party.

trans-unit.source: Do NOT check <ui>Local BizTalk processes messages received by the party or supports sending messages from this party</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Do NOT check <ui>Local BizTalk processes messages received by the party or supports sending messages from this party</ui>.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>How to Create a Party</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247301</linkUri></externalLink> provides the details.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>How to Create a Party</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247301</linkUri></externalLink> provides the details.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link> provides the steps.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link> provides the steps.

trans-unit.source: To summarize on how to create a “partner”:
trans-unit.target: To summarize on how to create a “partner”:

trans-unit.source: Do <legacyBold>NOT</legacyBold> check the <ui>Local BizTalk processes messages received by the party or supports sending messages from this party</ui> option in the party properties.
trans-unit.target: Do <legacyBold>NOT</legacyBold> check the <ui>Local BizTalk processes messages received by the party or supports sending messages from this party</ui> option in the party properties.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following table compares the “profile” settings in BizTalk Server with the “profile” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: The following table compares the “profile” settings in BizTalk Server with the “profile” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: This table lists the task involved to add or edit a profile.
trans-unit.target: This table lists the task involved to add or edit a profile.

trans-unit.source: It lists the “profile” tasks in BizTalk Server and the replacement “profile” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: It lists the “profile” tasks in BizTalk Server and the replacement “profile” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: When a party is created in BizTalk Administration, a profile is automatically created.
trans-unit.target: When a party is created in BizTalk Administration, a profile is automatically created.

trans-unit.source: General: Includes Name, Description, and Additional Properties.
trans-unit.target: General: Includes Name, Description, and Additional Properties.

trans-unit.source: Identities: Includes an identity qualifier, like Mutually Defined ZZ.
trans-unit.target: Identities: Includes an identity qualifier, like Mutually Defined ZZ.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Configuring Business Profile Properties</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247331</linkUri></externalLink> provides the steps to add/edit a party profile.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Configuring Business Profile Properties</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247331</linkUri></externalLink> provides the steps to add/edit a party profile.

trans-unit.source: When a partner is created in the <token>tpm_portal</token>, a profile is automatically created.
trans-unit.target: When a partner is created in the <token>tpm_portal</token>, a profile is automatically created.

trans-unit.source: Click the partner name to edit similar properties:
trans-unit.target: Click the partner name to edit similar properties:

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link> provides the steps to add and edit a partner profile.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link> provides the steps to add and edit a partner profile.

trans-unit.source: To summarize on how to create a profile:
trans-unit.target: To summarize on how to create a profile:

trans-unit.source: When a party is created in BizTalk Server, a profile is automatically created.
trans-unit.target: When a party is created in BizTalk Server, a profile is automatically created.

trans-unit.source: When a party is created in <token>af_integration</token>, a profile is automatically created.
trans-unit.target: When a party is created in <token>af_integration</token>, a profile is automatically created.

trans-unit.source: To start configuring profiles, see <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Managing Partners and Profiles</link>.
trans-unit.target: To start configuring profiles, see <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Managing Partners and Profiles</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following tables compare the “agreement” settings in BizTalk Server with the “agreement” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: The following tables compare the “agreement” settings in BizTalk Server with the “agreement” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: Add an Agreement: X12 General settings
trans-unit.target: Add an Agreement: X12 General settings

trans-unit.source: This table lists the different tasks involved when adding an agreement and configuring “General” settings.
trans-unit.target: This table lists the different tasks involved when adding an agreement and configuring “General” settings.

trans-unit.source: It lists the “agreement” tasks in BizTalk Server and the replacement “agreement” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: It lists the “agreement” tasks in BizTalk Server and the replacement “agreement” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: A profile is required to create an agreement.
trans-unit.target: A profile is required to create an agreement.

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Administration, right-click the profile and create a new agreement.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Administration, right-click the profile and create a new agreement.

trans-unit.source: This option displays the following properties:
trans-unit.target: This option displays the following properties:

trans-unit.source: General Properties: Includes the agreement name, the X12 protocol, the First Party, the Second Party, enabling the agreement and logging.
trans-unit.target: General Properties: Includes the agreement name, the X12 protocol, the First Party, the Second Party, enabling the agreement and logging.

trans-unit.source: Additional Properties: Include any name-value pair.
trans-unit.target: Additional Properties: Include any name-value pair.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Configuring General Settings (X12)</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247459</linkUri></externalLink> provides the steps to edit these properties.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Configuring General Settings (X12)</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247459</linkUri></externalLink> provides the steps to edit these properties.

trans-unit.source: No identifiers are configured in the General properties in BizTalk Server.
trans-unit.target: No identifiers are configured in the General properties in BizTalk Server.

trans-unit.source: A profile is required to create an agreement.
trans-unit.target: A profile is required to create an agreement.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Agreements</ui> and then click the <ui>X12</ui> tab.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Agreements</ui> and then click the <ui>X12</ui> tab.

trans-unit.source: The General tab is opened and displays the following properties:
trans-unit.target: The General tab is opened and displays the following properties:

trans-unit.source: Hosted Partner Qualifier and Value (ISA5 and ISA6).
trans-unit.target: Hosted Partner Qualifier and Value (ISA5 and ISA6).

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Server, ISA5 and ISA6 are configured in the agreement receive and send properties.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Server, ISA5 and ISA6 are configured in the agreement receive and send properties.

trans-unit.source: Guest Partner Qualifier and Value (ISA5 and ISA6).
trans-unit.target: Guest Partner Qualifier and Value (ISA5 and ISA6).

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Server, ISA5 and ISA6 are configured in the agreement receive and send properties.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Server, ISA5 and ISA6 are configured in the agreement receive and send properties.

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Server, errors can be logged when EDI reporting is enabled.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Server, errors can be logged when EDI reporting is enabled.

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Server, errors can be logged when EDI reporting is enabled.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Server, errors can be logged when EDI reporting is enabled.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an X12 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an X12 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: To summarize on how to create an agreement:
trans-unit.target: To summarize on how to create an agreement:

trans-unit.source: When an agreement is created in BizTalk Server, configure the <ui>General</ui> settings.
trans-unit.target: When an agreement is created in BizTalk Server, configure the <ui>General</ui> settings.

trans-unit.source: When an agreement is created in <token>af_integration</token>, configure the <ui>General Settings</ui>.
trans-unit.target: When an agreement is created in <token>af_integration</token>, configure the <ui>General Settings</ui>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an X12 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an X12 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: Add an Agreement: X12 Receive settings
trans-unit.target: Add an Agreement: X12 Receive settings

trans-unit.source: If you click another tab while creating the agreement, the agreement settings are not saved.
trans-unit.target: If you click another tab while creating the agreement, the agreement settings are not saved.

trans-unit.source: This table lists the different tasks involved when adding an agreement and configuring “Receive” settings.
trans-unit.target: This table lists the different tasks involved when adding an agreement and configuring “Receive” settings.

trans-unit.source: It lists the “agreement” tasks in BizTalk Server and the replacement “agreement” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: It lists the “agreement” tasks in BizTalk Server and the replacement “agreement” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: When you click OK in the Agreement General Properties, two new tabs display: <ui>First Party->Second Party</ui> and <ui>Second Party->First Party</ui>.
trans-unit.target: When you click OK in the Agreement General Properties, two new tabs display: <ui>First Party->Second Party</ui> and <ui>Second Party->First Party</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Second Party->First Party</ui> is the Receive.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Second Party->First Party</ui> is the Receive.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, First Party is the Service Provider; which means <ui>Local BizTalk processes messages received by the party or supports sending messages from this party</ui> is enabled for the First Party.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, First Party is the Service Provider; which means <ui>Local BizTalk processes messages received by the party or supports sending messages from this party</ui> is enabled for the First Party.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Agreements</ui>, click the <ui>X12</ui> tab, and then <ui>Create Agreement</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Agreements</ui>, click the <ui>X12</ui> tab, and then <ui>Create Agreement</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The General Settings are opened, which are previously described.
trans-unit.target: The General Settings are opened, which are previously described.

trans-unit.source: When the General Settings are added, click <ui>Continue</ui> to display the Receive properties.
trans-unit.target: When the General Settings are added, click <ui>Continue</ui> to display the Receive properties.

trans-unit.source: This agreement in BizTalk Server translate to two separate agreements in <token>af_integration</token>:
trans-unit.target: This agreement in BizTalk Server translate to two separate agreements in <token>af_integration</token>:

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Agreement 1</legacyBold>: First Party is the Hosted Partner.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Agreement 1</legacyBold>: First Party is the Hosted Partner.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Agreement 2</legacyBold>: Second Party is the Hosted Partner.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Agreement 2</legacyBold>: Second Party is the Hosted Partner.

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Server, the receive agreement and send agreement can have a different pair of sender and receiver identities (ISA 5, ISA6, ISA7, ISA8).
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Server, the receive agreement and send agreement can have a different pair of sender and receiver identities (ISA 5, ISA6, ISA7, ISA8).

trans-unit.source: In <token>af_integration</token>, the identity pair is the same for receive and send agreements.
trans-unit.target: In <token>af_integration</token>, the identity pair is the same for receive and send agreements.

trans-unit.source: It lists the “agreement” tasks in BizTalk Server and the replacement “agreement” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: It lists the “agreement” tasks in BizTalk Server and the replacement “agreement” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: A profile is required to create an agreement.
trans-unit.target: A profile is required to create an agreement.

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Administration, right-click the profile and create a new agreement.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Administration, right-click the profile and create a new agreement.

trans-unit.source: This option displays the following properties:
trans-unit.target: This option displays the following properties:

trans-unit.source: General Properties: Includes the agreement name, the AS2 protocol, the First Party, the Second Party, enabling the agreement and logging.
trans-unit.target: General Properties: Includes the agreement name, the AS2 protocol, the First Party, the Second Party, enabling the agreement and logging.

trans-unit.source: Additional Properties: Include any name-value pair.
trans-unit.target: Additional Properties: Include any name-value pair.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Configuring General Party Properties (AS2)</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247461</linkUri></externalLink> provide the steps to edit these properties.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Configuring General Party Properties (AS2)</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=247461</linkUri></externalLink> provide the steps to edit these properties.

trans-unit.source: No identifiers are configured in the General properties in BizTalk Server.
trans-unit.target: No identifiers are configured in the General properties in BizTalk Server.

trans-unit.source: A profile is required to create an agreement.
trans-unit.target: A profile is required to create an agreement.

trans-unit.source: The General tab is opened and displays the following properties:
trans-unit.target: The General tab is opened and displays the following properties:

trans-unit.source: Hosted Partner: Equivalent to First Party.
trans-unit.target: Hosted Partner: Equivalent to First Party.

trans-unit.source: AS2 Identity: Equivalent to <ui>AS2-From</ui> and <ui>AS2-To</ui> in BizTalk Server.
trans-unit.target: AS2 Identity: Equivalent to <ui>AS2-From</ui> and <ui>AS2-To</ui> in BizTalk Server.

trans-unit.source: Guest Partner: Equivalent to Second Party.
trans-unit.target: Guest Partner: Equivalent to Second Party.

trans-unit.source: AS2 Identity: AS2 Identity: Equivalent to <ui>AS2-From</ui> and <ui>AS2-To</ui> in BizTalk Server.
trans-unit.target: AS2 Identity: AS2 Identity: Equivalent to <ui>AS2-From</ui> and <ui>AS2-To</ui> in BizTalk Server.

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Server, the following acknowledgment options are telling the sending party to include the MDN.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Server, the following acknowledgment options are telling the sending party to include the MDN.

trans-unit.source: Another way of saying this is that receiving party is “requesting” the MDN.
trans-unit.target: Another way of saying this is that receiving party is “requesting” the MDN.

trans-unit.source: Process inbound MDN into MessageBox for routing/delivery options
trans-unit.target: Process inbound MDN into MessageBox for routing/delivery options

trans-unit.source: Request asynchronous MDN, including the Receipt-Delivery Option URL
trans-unit.target: Request asynchronous MDN, including the Receipt-Delivery Option URL

trans-unit.source: Resend AS2 message if MDN not received
trans-unit.target: Resend AS2 message if MDN not received

trans-unit.source: In <token>af_integration</token>, acknowledgment messages are sent from the managed partner to the unmanaged partner (based on the Transport URL in the Send Settings).
trans-unit.target: In <token>af_integration</token>, acknowledgment messages are sent from the managed partner to the unmanaged partner (based on the Transport URL in the Send Settings).

trans-unit.source: Receive URL Settings, which includes the URL scheme (HTTP or HTTPS) and the URL Suffix.
trans-unit.target: Receive URL Settings, which includes the URL scheme (HTTP or HTTPS) and the URL Suffix.

trans-unit.source: This option is equivalent to the <ui>Receipt-Delivery Option URL</ui> in BizTalk Server.
trans-unit.target: This option is equivalent to the <ui>Receipt-Delivery Option URL</ui> in BizTalk Server.

trans-unit.target: Process inbound MDN into MessageBox for routing/delivery options

trans-unit.source: Resend AS2 message if MDN not received
trans-unit.target: Resend AS2 message if MDN not received

trans-unit.target: Tracking is enabled at the General Settings.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Route Settings</ui> tab, you can route to the following:
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Route Settings</ui> tab, you can route to the following:

trans-unit.source: To summarize on how to add AS2 Receive settings:
trans-unit.target: To summarize on how to add AS2 Receive settings:

trans-unit.source: When an agreement is created in BizTalk Server, configure the <ui>General</ui> settings and then configure the Receive settings.
trans-unit.target: When an agreement is created in BizTalk Server, configure the <ui>General</ui> settings and then configure the Receive settings.

trans-unit.source: When an agreement is created in <token>af_integration</token>, configure the <ui>General Settings</ui> and then configure the <ui>Receive Settings</ui>.
trans-unit.target: When an agreement is created in <token>af_integration</token>, configure the <ui>General Settings</ui> and then configure the <ui>Receive Settings</ui>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: Add an agreement: AS2 Send settings
trans-unit.target: Add an agreement: AS2 Send settings

trans-unit.source: If you click another tab while creating the agreement, the agreement settings are not saved.
trans-unit.target: If you click another tab while creating the agreement, the agreement settings are not saved.

trans-unit.source: This table lists the different tasks involved when adding an agreement and configuring “Send” settings.
trans-unit.target: This table lists the different tasks involved when adding an agreement and configuring “Send” settings.

trans-unit.source: It lists the “agreement” tasks in BizTalk Server and the replacement “agreement” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: It lists the “agreement” tasks in BizTalk Server and the replacement “agreement” settings in <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: When you click OK in the Agreement General Properties, two new tabs display: <ui>First Party->Second Party</ui> and <ui>Second Party->First Party</ui>.
trans-unit.target: When you click OK in the Agreement General Properties, two new tabs display: <ui>First Party->Second Party</ui> and <ui>Second Party->First Party</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>First Party->Second Party</ui> is the Send.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>First Party->Second Party</ui> is the Send.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Agreements</ui>, click the AS2 tab, and<ui ></ui> then click <ui>Create Agreement</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Agreements</ui>, click the AS2 tab, and<ui ></ui> then click <ui>Create Agreement</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The General Settings are opened, which are previously described.
trans-unit.target: The General Settings are opened, which are previously described.

trans-unit.source: When the General Settings are added, click <ui>Continue</ui> and then click the Send tab to display the Send properties.
trans-unit.target: When the General Settings are added, click <ui>Continue</ui> and then click the Send tab to display the Send properties.

trans-unit.source: Equivalent to <ui>AS2 Identity</ui> in the <ui>General Settings</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Equivalent to <ui>AS2 Identity</ui> in the <ui>General Settings</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Check Certification Revocation List on receipt of message
trans-unit.target: Check Certification Revocation List on receipt of message

trans-unit.source: Check for duplicate messages within the following number of days
trans-unit.target: Check for duplicate messages within the following number of days

trans-unit.source: Following are the equivalent configuration settings:
trans-unit.target: Following are the equivalent configuration settings:

trans-unit.source: No equivalent configuration for the following BizTalk Server settings:
trans-unit.target: No equivalent configuration for the following BizTalk Server settings:

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Server, the following acknowledgment options are telling the sending party to include the MDN.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Server, the following acknowledgment options are telling the sending party to include the MDN.

trans-unit.source: Another way of saying this is that receiving party is “requesting” the MDN.
trans-unit.target: Another way of saying this is that receiving party is “requesting” the MDN.

trans-unit.source: Process inbound MDN into MessageBox for routing/delivery options
trans-unit.target: Process inbound MDN into MessageBox for routing/delivery options

trans-unit.source: Resend AS2 message if MDN not received
trans-unit.target: Resend AS2 message if MDN not received

trans-unit.source: In <token>af_integration</token>, this setting configures the agreement to send MDN receipts to the sender on the original AS2 message after the message has been delivered.
trans-unit.target: In <token>af_integration</token>, this setting configures the agreement to send MDN receipts to the sender on the original AS2 message after the message has been delivered.

trans-unit.source: Transport Settings: This option is equivalent to the <ui>Receipt-Delivery Option URL</ui> in BizTalk Server.
trans-unit.target: Transport Settings: This option is equivalent to the <ui>Receipt-Delivery Option URL</ui> in BizTalk Server.

trans-unit.source: No equivalent configuration for the following BizTalk Server settings:
trans-unit.target: No equivalent configuration for the following BizTalk Server settings:

trans-unit.source: Process inbound MDN into MessageBox for routing/delivery options
trans-unit.target: Process inbound MDN into MessageBox for routing/delivery options

trans-unit.source: Resend AS2 message if MDN not received
trans-unit.target: Resend AS2 message if MDN not received

trans-unit.source: Tracking is enabled at the General Settings.
trans-unit.target: Tracking is enabled at the General Settings.

trans-unit.source: Certificates are added when a partner is configured.
trans-unit.target: Certificates are added when a partner is configured.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="5b993139-3261-49b2-a778-f46aee74365b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Manage Partners and Profiles in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: To summarize on how to add AS2 Send settings:
trans-unit.target: To summarize on how to add AS2 Send settings:

trans-unit.source: When an agreement is created in BizTalk Server, configure the <ui>General</ui> settings, configure the Receive settings, and then configure the Send settings.
trans-unit.target: When an agreement is created in BizTalk Server, configure the <ui>General</ui> settings, configure the Receive settings, and then configure the Send settings.

trans-unit.source: When an agreement is created in <token>af_integration</token>, configure the <ui>General Settings</ui>, configure the <ui>Receive Settings</ui>, and then configure the <ui>Send Settings</ui>.
trans-unit.target: When an agreement is created in <token>af_integration</token>, configure the <ui>General Settings</ui>, configure the <ui>Receive Settings</ui>, and then configure the <ui>Send Settings</ui>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Server, an agreement has <ui>General Settings</ui>, <ui>Second Party->First Party</ui> (Receive) settings and <ui>First Party->Second Party</ui> (Send) settings.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Server, an agreement has <ui>General Settings</ui>, <ui>Second Party->First Party</ui> (Receive) settings and <ui>First Party->Second Party</ui> (Send) settings.

trans-unit.source: Each settings section is separated by tabs when creating an agreement in BizTalk Administration.
trans-unit.target: Each settings section is separated by tabs when creating an agreement in BizTalk Administration.

trans-unit.source: In <token>af_integration</token>, an agreement has <ui>General Settings</ui>, <ui>Receive Settings</ui> and <ui>Send Settings</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In <token>af_integration</token>, an agreement has <ui>General Settings</ui>, <ui>Receive Settings</ui> and <ui>Send Settings</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Each settings section is separated by tabs when creating an agreement in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: Each settings section is separated by tabs when creating an agreement in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Creating New AS2 Agreements</link> and <link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Creating New X12 Agreements</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Creating New AS2 Agreements</link> and <link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Creating New X12 Agreements</link>.

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Server, when an Agreement is configured, you <ui>Enable</ui> the agreement in BizTalk Administration by right-clicking the Agreement and clicking <ui>Enable</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Server, when an Agreement is configured, you <ui>Enable</ui> the agreement in BizTalk Administration by right-clicking the Agreement and clicking <ui>Enable</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In <token>af_integration</token> when the Agreement is configured, you <ui>Deploy</ui> the agreement in the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page by clicking <ui>Deploy</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In <token>af_integration</token> when the Agreement is configured, you <ui>Deploy</ui> the agreement in the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page by clicking <ui>Deploy</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In BizTalk Server, you <ui>Enable</ui> an agreement in BizTalk Administration.
trans-unit.target: In BizTalk Server, you <ui>Enable</ui> an agreement in BizTalk Administration.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>How to Enable or Disable an Agreement</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=247617</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>How to Enable or Disable an Agreement</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=247617</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: In <token>af_integration</token>, you <ui>Deploy</ui> an agreement in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: In <token>af_integration</token>, you <ui>Deploy</ui> an agreement in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
